histore.document.df module¶

Document wrapper around data frames.

class histore.document.df.DataFrameDocument(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, readorder: Optional[List[int]] = None)¶

Bases: histore.document.base.Document

Create an in-memory document for a pandas data frame.

close()¶

Set the internal reference to the data frame to None when the document is closed.

open() → histore.document.df.DataFrameIterator¶

Open the document to get a iterator for the rows in the document.

Returns

Return type

histore.document.df.DataFrameIterator

read_df() → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Return the associated data frame.

Returns

Return type

pd.DataFrame

sorted(keys: List[int], buffersize: Optional[float] = None) → histore.document.df.DataFrameDocument¶

Sort the document rows based on the values in the key columns.

Key columns are specified by their index position. Returns a new document.

Parameters

  • keys (list of int) – Index position of sort columns.

  • buffersize (float, default=None) – Maximum size (in bytes) of file blocks that are kept in main-memory. Ignored. Included for API completeness.

Returns

Return type

histore.document.df.DataFrameDocument

class histore.document.df.DataFrameIterator(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, readorder: Optional[List[int]] = None)¶

Bases: histore.document.base.DocumentIterator

Document iterator for data frames.

close()¶

Set the associated data frame and read order to None.

has_next() → bool¶

Test if the iterator has more rows to read.

Returns

Return type

bool

next() → Tuple[int, Union[int, float, str, datetime.datetime, Tuple[Union[int, float, str, datetime.datetime], …]], List[Union[int, float, str, datetime.datetime]]]¶

Read the next row in the document.

Returns the row position, row index and the list of cell values for each of the document columns. Raises a StopIteration error if an attempt is made to read past the end of the document.

Returns

Return type

tuple of int, histore.document.base.RowIndex, histore.document.base.DataRow

histore.document.df.nan_to_none(value: Any) → Any¶

Convert NaN values to None.

Parameters

value (any) – Cell value.

Returns

Return type

any

histore.document.df.rowindex_readorder(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → List[int]¶

Get read order for rows in a pandas data frame based on their index.

Sorts the rows based on the index and returns a list with initial row positions in sorted order. Index values that are None or -1 are considered new rows that are moved to the end of the sorted list.

Parameters

df (pd.DataFrame) – Input data frame.

Returns

Return type

list of int
